content:
The Imperial Palace East Garden Loop is a beautiful and peaceful jogging route, and Komeda's Coffee is a great spot to refuel afterwards.

At Komeda's Coffee, I recommend trying their "Komeda's Breakfast" set, which is a popular choice among locals and visitors alike. This set includes:

1. Toast with butter and jam
2. Scrambled eggs
3. Sausage (Japanese-style sausage, which is usually made from pork and has a milder flavor than Western-style sausage)
4. Hash browns
5. Coffee or tea (your choice)

This set is a great way to start your day, with a balance of protein, complex carbs, and a bit of caffeine to get you going. The scrambled eggs are made fresh in-house, and the sausage is cooked to perfection. The toast with butter and jam is a nice touch, and the hash browns add some crispy texture to the dish.

If you're looking for something a bit lighter, you could try their "Toast Set" which includes toast with butter and jam, along with a coffee or tea. They also have a variety of sandwiches and pastries if you're in the mood for something a bit more substantial.

Remember to order at the counter, and then take a seat at one of the tables or counters to enjoy your breakfast. The staff at Komeda's Coffee are friendly and efficient, so you'll be in and out quickly and ready to start your day in Tokyo!
